title: The Writer's Almanac - Sunday, May 9, 2021
description: It’s the 100th birthday of Pulitzer Prize-winning poet Mona Van Duyn (1921). She said, "I believe that good poetry can be as ornate as a cathedral or as bare as a pottingshed, as long as it confronts the self with honesty and fullness.”
itunes:author: Prairie Home Productions
